facts.title: The book I'm reading recently
facts.content: Currently reading 'Wanting: The Power of Mimetic Desire in Everyday Life' by Luke Burgis. It explores how mimetic desire shapes our choices in business, relationships, and life.

facts.title: My first DSLR camera
facts.content: Nikon D810 with its 36.3MP full-frame sensor. The lack of an anti-aliasing filter delivers incredibly sharp images, perfect for capturing detailed landscapes.

facts.title: My recent camera purchase
facts.content: Fujifilm X-T4 with its 26.1MP APS-C sensor and 5-axis stabilization. The film simulations and 4K/60p video capabilities make it perfect for hybrid shooting.

facts.title: My first computer
facts.content: HP desktop with Pentium 4 processor. That machine introduced me to the world of computing and sparked my interest in technology.

facts.title: My first video game
facts.content: Super Mario Bros. on the original Nintendo console. The iconic music and gameplay mechanics still bring back childhood memories of endless gaming sessions.

facts.title: My longest hiking adventure
facts.content: Coloane Island trail in Macau, exploring the coastal paths around Cheoc Van area. The stunning sea views and peaceful atmosphere made it an unforgettable experience.
